data.title: About
data.meta_description: New Zealand Tavua Football Club Incorporated (NZ Tavua) is a not-for-profit, volunteer-run organisation which aims to promote and participate in sporting and cultural activities.  Commonly known as...
data.text:
About Us

New Zealand Tavua Football Club Incorporated (NZ Tavua) is a not-for-profit, volunteer-run organisation which aims to promote and participate in sporting and cultural activities.

Commonly known as Tavua, it was established in 1989 in South Auckland by soccer loving migrants from Fiji. Since its inception, Tavua has without doubt established itself as one of New Zealands premier ethnic based teams. In 2014, Tavua celebrated its 25th jubilee.

Tavua is one of the oldest clubs affiliated to the NZ Fiji Football Association (NZFFA) based at Mangere Centre Park - an association with over a 1000 members. Tavua is one of the most successful team in the association.

In addition to competing locally, Tavua has also travelled overseas numerous times to tour as a sports team – most recently to Australia in 2013.

Founded in 1989 in South Auckland by soccer loving migrants from Fiji, NZ Tavua was originally known as "The Backline Boys". Backline Boys Tavua was perhaps the only team totally comprising of Fijians playing in the local football leagues in the late 1980's.

Tavua affiliated to NZ Fiji Football in 1990 and since then is a FIVE time winner of the Inter-District Championship (IDC), the most prestigious tournament organised by NZFFA. Tavua has also won numerous Fiji FACT tournaments including a five-in-a-row streak in the first five Fiji FACT tournaments, and has also had many triumphs in the Battle of Giant (BOG) tournaments.

Over the years, many high-profile footballers have donned the famous Tavua yellow jersey. Geoff Gray and Ryan Dawkins were All Whites who have played for Tavua. All Whites age group representatives to have played for Tavua have included Sam Margetts, Hugo Littlejohn, Craig Dale, Sean Lovemore, Naveen Prasad, Blair Konik, Ross Havilland and Jacob Mathews.

Fiji internationals that have played for Tavua include Ramu Prasad, Gajen Naidu, Mukesh Chand, Malakai Kainihewe, Tuimasi Manuca, Osea Vakatalesau, Apisalome Turuva, Uliaisi Tamanisau, Kartik Kumar, Saten Raju, Isikeli Seva, Vinod Kumar and Salesh Kumar. There was even a Samoan international goalkeeper that has played for Tavua, Masi Toetu and former Fiji football and futsal international, Shailendra Lal is still one of Tavuas' playing members!

Roy Krishna, striker for Wellington Phoenix and captain of the Fijian national side, is currently in the Tavua squad having last played for Tavua in the IDC 2013 semifinal. There are also four Auckland City FC players (Darren White, Sam Burfoot, Takuya Iwata) and one Wellington City player (Adam Cowan) in Tavua's current playing squad. Adam is now considered one of the stalwarts of the Tavua team having racked up dozens of games for Tavua since 2009!

This year, Tavua has won two out of the three NZFFA titles - the Battle of Giants and Fiji FACT titles.
